info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:29AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Joseph, northern La Porte and western Berrien Counties through 630 AM EDT/530 AM CDT/... At 529 AM EDT/429 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles northwest of Stevensville to near Long Beach to near South Haven. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Trail Creek and Long Beach around 535 AM EDT. New Buffalo around 540 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Three Oaks, Shorewood-Tower Hill, Westville, New Carlisle, Stevensville, St. Joseph, Fair Plain, La Porte, Benton Harbor, Benton Heights and Buchanan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 38 and 69. Interstate 94 in Indiana between mile markers 33 and 45. Interstate 94 in Michigan between mile markers 0 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
